lexUnit.name: mere.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: that is solely, or no more or better than, what is specified.

sentence.text: Nominally they retained their autonomous status , but their provincial assemblies effectively became mere rubber-stamp bodies , and the powers of their provincial governments and judiciary were drastically curtailed .

But some hospitals and some wards of other hospitals have failed to cope with the demands of too many chronic patients , and lack adequate staff , money and enthusiasm to prevent them becoming mere dumping grounds , especially of the psycho-geriatric cases .
This is not mere grumbling or sourness , but a perfectly normal reaction to her circumstances .

The courts ruled that such companies only had the powers specifically granted to them by Parliament , and the ruling was extended to local authorities despite the fact that they were independently elected , not mere private corporations .
Although traditionalists , the best of these were not mere epigones .

Such rules are not mere statistical abstractions but are directly discoverable , as we will attempt to show , in the accounts which football fans and schoolroom ` trouble makers '' offer in explaining what they do and why they do it .
My lord was a lion amongst men -- but his sons are as yet mere cubs ! ''
Brooches , bracelets and pendants were no mere accessories to be added to an outfit as art afterthought ; they were chosen with care and worn with pride .

The handmaids of the Everqueen are not mere courtiers ; they are her warrior guard -- a hundred beautiful Elf-maids schooled in the arts of war till they exceed or even surpass the greatest of Elf knights with sword , bow and lance .
Sophocles shows how it happens , to people and through people , who are not mere puppets , but free agents .
A mere 130-220kg of HEU , accumulated in its own enrichment programme , has made Pakistan a nuclear power .
As that doyen of golf-writers , the late Henry Longhurst said , ` A good caddie is more than a mere assistant , he is guide , philosopher and friend . ''

At the mere mention of a coat , she sits , eyes closed , nose pointing upwards to have it slipped on , then stands for the belt to be fastened .
Now the girl lived in the care of the nuns at Syon on the Thames , a mere shadow of her former self .

The mere thought brought a tremor to her legs .
At the mere thought of the word shift his penis leaped doggily to attention .
Limiting oneself to just the products that run on the standard graphics card , be it colour or monochrome , reduces the options to a mere handful .
However , Lazarsfeld , though primarily a methodologist , was no mere technician .
